meanings.sent1: The hypomorphic engine struggled to power the small car.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a gene with reduced activity.
meanings.sent1: The hypomorphic gene caused the plant to grow slower than usual.
meanings.sent2: Scientists studied the hypomorphic mutation to understand its effects on the organism.
meanings.sent3: The hypomorphic gene played a quiet role in the genetic makeup of the species.
meanings.sent4: His hypomorphic traits made him stand out from others in the family.
meanings.sent5: The hypomorphic DNA strand struggled to replicate accurately during cell division.

meanings.definition: Showing a less severe phenotype compared to the wild-type.
meanings.sent1: The hypomorphic flower had lighter petals than its wild-type counterpart.
meanings.sent2: The hypomorphic strain of bacteria grew more slowly but was less harmful.
meanings.sent3: The hypomorphic fruit looked odd but tasted surprisingly delicious.
meanings.sent4: Her hypomorphic skin condition caused occasional rashes but was manageable.
meanings.sent5: The hypomorphic bird had unique coloring that made it easy to spot in the forest.
